name: Kitfo
description: Discover the rich flavors of Ethiopia with our most popular dishes—authentic, time-honored recipes loved by locals and visitors alike.

name: Tibs
description: Discover the rich flavors of Ethiopia with our most popular dishes—authentic, time-honored recipes loved by locals and visitors alike.

name: Injera
description: A sourdough flatbread made from teff flour, injera is the staple of Ethiopian cuisine, served with various stews and salads on top.

name: Doro Wat
description: A spicy chicken stew simmered in berbere spice and niter kibbeh, traditionally served with a hard-boiled egg and injera.

name: Shiro
description: A rich, thick stew made from ground chickpeas or broad beans, seasoned with garlic, onions, and Ethiopian spices.

name: Gomen
description: A savory dish of slow-cooked collard greens, spiced with garlic, onions, and sometimes enriched with clarified butter.

name: Chechebsa
description: A traditional breakfast dish made from torn pieces of flatbread sautéed in spiced butter and berbere, often served with honey or yogurt.

name: Genfo
description: A thick porridge made from barley or wheat flour, typically served with a spicy, buttery berbere sauce in the center.
